Key Match Events: David Miller finished unbeaten on 59 off 46 as he saw South Africa over the line in their chase of a target of 134.
Lungi Ngidi's searing four-wicket haul and the efforts of the rest of the South African pacers meant that India were off to a disastrous start batting first.
Suryakumar Yadav's 68 off 40 balls almost single-handedly got India to 133/9.
Arshdeep Singh, Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Mohammed Shami kept South Africa pinned after India's initial struggles.
Aiden Markram and Miller stemmed the flow of wickets after the powerplay and eventually saw South Africa over the line with two balls to spare.
Post-Match Reflections: India have to beat Bangladesh by a fairly big margin in their last match so as to keep their net run rate above the rest of the chasing pack.
Rohit Sharma stated that they were not good enough on the field and missed chances, including run-outs.
South Africa won the game due to Miller's innings and the bowling efforts of Lungi Ngidi.
